results.title: Boys and Balls
results.creator_credit: Sue Thomson, Anna Grieve, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Gil Scrine Films and Thermal Falls
results.brief_description: It is in games many men discover their paradise. Robert Lynd. H.G. Nelson (Greig Pickhaver) and Rampaging Roy Slaven (John Doyle) host an amusing, often hilarious exploration of the fascination of men with balls; whether it is a cricket, football, tennis, basketball, soccer, bowls, table tennis, hockey or golf ball! Celebrities including Ted Whitten, Ron Barassi, Merv Hughes, Derek Kickett, Andrew Gaze, Lindsay Gaze, Francis Awaritife, Brad Mackay, Greg Champion and the average bloke and kid next door share favourite childhood memories of their sporting idols, humerous moments, coaching temperaments, the importance of rules and umpiring, and the incidence of sporting violence. Interviews, archival footage and famous quotes are intermixed in this perceptive program.

results.title: Queen Kelly
results.creator_credit: Erich Von Stroheim, Gloria Swanson and Gloria Swanson Pictures
results.brief_description: In this melodrama, Gloria Swanson plays Patricia Kelly, a naive and innocent convent girl, who catches the eye of the decadent Prince of a small European country, when her underpants accidentally fall down. He embarks on a scandalous affair with her but when the Prince’s fiancee, mad Queen Regina (Seena Owen) learns of the affair she is enraged and intervenes. In one, now famous scene, she drives Patricia from the Palace, brandishing a whip. Although Stroheim was fired by Swanson after shooting only a third of the film, the final result reflects his fascination with perversion, decadent living and forbidden love between social classes.

results.title: Foolish wives
results.creator_credit: Erich Von Stroheim and Universal Productions
results.brief_description: Posing as a Russian count, Stroheim preys on women; regardless of social class or status. Set in Monte Carlo, the subject matter was considered “repulsive and continental.” Stroheim, bewitching in his monacle is a satanic seducer intent on possessing the wife of an American diplomat from under his nose. The wife is more than obviously attracted to the Count’s fatal charm. “Foolish wives” was an expensive production in its day, and the excellence of the sets and costumes, along with Stroheim’s masterly direction make it a cinema classic.

results.title: No sex, no violence, no news
results.creator_credit: Stefan Moore, Susan Lambert and Film Australia
results.brief_description: No sex, no violence, no news is the programing policy of China’s biggest satellite TV network. Following producers, distributors, satellite moguls and advertising executives, this documentary looks at how business is conducted in a strange world where official party propaganda merges with Hollywood and MTV. The competition is fierce in the struggle to access China’s huge television audience and rapidly expanding consumer market. This program explores the impact of global TV on modern China, offering a fascinating insight into Chinese society and values.

results.title: To Catch a thief
results.brief_description: The French Riviera serves as the picturesque backdrop for this classic, suspenseful Hitchcock caper with Cary Grant as John Robie, a reformed cat burglar once known as “The Cat”, suspected in a new wave of jewel thefts from luxury hotels. Meeting pampered heiress Frances (Grace Kelly at her most ravishing), he sees the chance to bait the mysterious thief with her mothers’ (Jessie Royce Landis) fabulous jewels and clear himself of suspicion. His plan backfires, but Frances, who believes him guilty, proves her love by helping him escape and in a spine-tingling climax, the real criminal is exposed. Script including the much-imitated fireworks scene by John Michael Hayes. The cinematography by Robert Burks won the Oscar for Best Cinematography, 1954. Co-starring John Williams, Charles Vanel, Brigitte Auber, Jean Martinelli and Georgette Anys. Based on the novel by David Dodge.

results.title: Dot in space
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Dot’s new adventure takes her into outer space. She decides to resue Whyka, a Russian dog who is circling the Earth in a broken satellite. Once Dot saves Whyka, her troubles really begin. Her spacehip, Atlanta, crashes onto a planet called Pie-Arr-Squared. The inhabitants, called Roundies, imprison Dot and Whyka with the “Squaries”, unfortunate beings who are not considered round enough!

results.title: Charly
results.creator_credit: Ralph Nelson, Robertson and Associates and Selmur Productions
results.brief_description: Charly Gordon (Cliff Robertson) is a gentle adult with the mind of a child. His determination to improve attracts the attention of his nightschool teacher, Alice (Claire Bloom). Charly exists in a world bound by his room and his job as a bakery sweep. Alice persuades a clinic to help Charly and the doctors agree to use him as a subject for experimental neuro-surgery. The operation is successful. Charly’s mind develops and he learns quickly, but his emotional growth does not keep pace. He appears before a convention as living proof of the surgery results and brilliantly answers questions. However, shortly before his appearance, he makes a frightening discovery; and the film ends with an unexpected resolution. Co-starring Lilia Skala, Leon Janney, Ruth White and Richard Van Patton. Cliff Robertson won an Oscar for his performance, a role he first tackled on TV’s U.S. Steel Hour in 1961. Based on the novel “Flowers for Algernon” by Daniel Keyes.

results.title: The Wedding banquet
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, James Schamus, Ted Hope, Central Motion Pictures Corporation and Good Machine
results.brief_description: Wai Tung, a successful real estate investor lives in New York with his lover Simon. Wai Tung’s parents, wondering why he is unmarried, enrol him with a matchmaking service. Simon believes the solution is for Wai Tung to marry Wei Wei, an illegal immigrant desperate to remain in America; a marriage of convenience solving both their problems! When the news reaches Taiwan, Wai Tung’s parents board the first plane to the Big Apple so they can preside over the traditional wedding banquet. Suddenly a little white lie turns into a fully fledged farce as the simple registry office ceremony escalates into an over-the-top reception where everyone wants to kiss the bride - except the groom! Starring Ah-Leh Gua, Sihung Lung, May Chin, Winston Chao and Mitchell Litchenstein. Winner Golden Bear Best Film: Berlin Film Festival, Best Director and Best Film: Seattle Film Festival, Critics Choice Best Film: Sydney Film Festival. Chinese dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Clear and present danger
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Mace Neufeld, Robert Rehme and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Tom Clancy created the hero Jack Ryan in a series of thriller espionage novels. Harrison Ford again plays the intrepid CIA agent. When his mentor (James Earl Jones) becomes gravely ill, Ryan is appointed CIA Deputy Director of Intelligence. A tough first assignment awaits when he is asked to investigate the murder of a personal friend of the President with secret ties to Columbian drug cartels. A deadly field operative (Willem Dafoe) has been despatched in a covert operation against the Columbians unbeknown to Ryan. Directed by Australia’s Philip Noyce, this is an action-packed film which looks at corruption in the corridors of power.
